Interface_name: HTTP Server - side based on XMLHttpRequest in JavaScript
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a JavaScript class that handles AJAX requests using XMLHttpRequest, supporting cross-origin requests, custom headers, and various response handling scenarios.

Class Description: The AjaxTransport class provides a wrapper around XMLHttpRequest for making asynchronous HTTP requests. It handles request creation, header management, response processing, and cleanup. The class supports CORS, maintains request state, and provides error handling capabilities.

Attributes:

xhrId: [Number] - Counter for generating unique IDs for each XMLHttpRequest instance
xhrCallbacks: [Object] - Stores callback functions for active requests
xhrSuccessStatus: [Object] - Maps certain HTTP status codes to standard success codes
xhrSupported: [XMLHttpRequest|Boolean] - Stores the created XMLHttpRequest instance or false if not supported

Methods:

createXHR: () -> [XMLHttpRequest|undefined] - Creates and returns a new XMLHttpRequest instance or undefined if creation fails

sendRequest: (options: Object, headers: Object, complete: Function) -> [undefined] - 
  Sends an AJAX request with the given configuration
  options: Contains request parameters (type, url, async, etc.)
  headers: Key-value pairs of request headers
  complete: Callback function to handle response

abortRequest: (callback: Function) -> [undefined] - 
  Aborts an active request and executes the given callback
  callback: Function to execute after aborting

getTransport: (options: Object) -> [Object|undefined] - 
  Returns a transport object if the request can be handled
  options: Configuration object for the request
  Returns an object with send and abort methods or undefined if request can't be handled
